
My English susks this time.
1.Create a new project and HelloJni.java content like below:

```
package com.jni.demo;
public class JNIDemo {
	//定义一个本地方法
	public native void sayHello();
	public static void main(String[] args){
		//调用动态链接库
		System.loadLibrary("JNIDemo");
		JNIDemo jniDemo = new JNIDemo();
		jniDemo.sayHello();
	}
}
```

2.open project's src dir and open cmd console then type:
```
javah com.jnitest.JNIDemo
```
3.press Enter you gonna see a new file com_jnitest_JNIDemo.h and content like below:

```
/* DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE - it is machine generated */
#include <jni.h>
/* Header for class com_jnitest_JNIDemo */

#ifndef _Included_com_jnitest_JNIDemo
#define _Included_com_jnitest_JNIDemo
#ifdef __cplusplus
extern "C" {
#endif
/*
 * Class:     com_jnitest_JNIDemo
 * Method:    sayHello
 * Signature: ()V
 */
JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_jnitest_JNIDemo_sayHello
  (JNIEnv *, jobject);

#ifdef __cplusplus
}
#endif
#endif

```

and new a file hello.c content like below:
** remember to extend the function you get from com_jnitest_JNIDemo.h **
```
#include "com_jnitest_JNIDemo.h"  

JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_jnitest_JNIDemo_sayHello (JNIEnv * env, jobject obj)
{
    printf("Hello Jni\n");  
    return;  
}
```
then compile hello.c,remember when you use 64bit JVM,you need to compile 64bit lib.
windows64 compile need gcc,which you can replace by MinGW-W64

```
gcc -I "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_172\include\win32" -I "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_172\include" -shared -s -o hellojni.dll hello.c
```

Then you got hellojni.dll in current dir,copy it to C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_172\bin

running your class and check if you can get 
```
Hello Jni
Hello Jni
Hello Jni
```
